title: AIML - Machine Learning Engineer, Siri Perception
summary: Play a part in the next revolution of human-machine interaction. Work with the people who created the intelligent voice assistant that helps millions of people get things done — just by talking to Siri. Join the Siri Perception team at Apple. The Siri Perception team is looking for a machine learning engineer to contribute to and influence the development of the next generation virtual assistant on Apple’s latest and most innovative devices. You should be passionate about hands-on work focused on research and development of new Siri experiences using data from multiple modalities, e.g., speech and vision.
description:
You will be a part of the research and development team who developed the Siri invocation and conversational interaction experiences on a full range of Apple’s devices. The position requires passion for researching and developing machine learning algorithms and systems. As part of the team, you will partner with the speech, vision, natural language understanding, and personalization teams, to deliver the best user experience with Siri. You must have a “make this happen” attitude, and be able to collaborate with various teams across Apple, to design user experiences, run user studies, collect data, and train/evaluate machine learning models.
Responsibilities:
        * Do research, design and deploy machine learning/deep learning models
        * Benchmarking and fine tuning machine learning/deep learning models
        * Optimizing algorithms for real time and low power constraints devices
        * Support algorithm deployment into Apple products
        * Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams across Apple
preferred_qualifications:
Proficiency in parquet, iceberg, AWS, pyspark and other data processing and analytics pipelines in big data ecosystems
Experience using data integration, processing, scalability, automation, and workflow orchestration tools
Good background of user study development and data collection to capture natural human-machine interaction
Consistent track record of researching, inventing and/or shipping advanced machine learning algorithms
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills with ability to work with cross-functional teams.
